roleset.name: examine

example.name: transitive
example.text: Every day, Mr. Levy checks orders from Campeau department store chains, [*-2] trying [*-3]to guess if he will be paid [*-1].
example.arg: orders from Campeau department store chains,
[*-2] trying [*-3]to guess if he will be paid [*-1].

example.name: just prepositional
example.text: The company, based [*] in San Francisco, said had [*] to shut down a crude-oil pipeline in the Bay area [*] to check for leaks but added that its refinery in nearby Richmond, Calif., was undamaged.

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1 and ARG2
example.text: Check out our Web site during the week for air times in your area MTP dot MSNBC dot com /.
example.arg: for air times in your area

example.name: arg 1 only
example.text: That idiotic GOP " Pledge to America " was ripped to shreds by Factcheck.org , but it wo n't matter because those who believe it -LRB- or at least believe in the idea of it -RRB- wo n't ever dare venture near a fact checking source .

example.name: All args
example.text: Carter held the crowd to laughter with his checking his watch for the time, when he is partly blind.

example.name: Arg 1 as "on" PP
example.text: I had Betty run through the numbers as an additional check on my calculations.

example.name: ARG1
example.text: When you 're feeling under the weather , all you need to do is buy a diagnostic biochip from the chemist 's shop , put a drop of urine onto it , and you will find out what is wrong with you - a health check will be as easy as a pregnancy test today .

example.name: All arguments
example.text: Her check of all the airlines for flights from Chicago to Toronto didn't turn up anything.
example.arg: for flights from Chicago to Toronto

roleset.note: CHECK-V NOTES: Frames file for 'check' based on sentences in financial subcorpus andautomatic expansion via verbnet. (from check.01-v predicate notes)
CHECKING-N NOTES: Roleset based on instances in BOLT P01. Comparison to verb entry check.01, which maps to VN class 35.2. No FN for gerund form. (from checking.01-n)
CHECK-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry check.01, OntoNotes grouping check-n sense 2; maps to VN class search-35.2. Framed by Claire. (from check.01-n)

roleset.name: make checkmarks

example.name: just like the SATs
example.text: Offering the wine at roughly $65 a bottle wholesale ($100 retail), he sent merchants around the country a form asking [*]to check one of three answers: 1) no, the wine is too high (2 responses); 2) yes, it's high but I 'll take it (2 responses); 3 ) I'll take all I can get (58 responses).
example.arg: one of three answers: 1) no, the wine is too high (2 responses); 2) yes, it's high but I 'll take it (2 responses); 3 ) I'll take all I can get (58 responses).

example.name: All args
example.text: He filed for divorce from Nancy in 2008, with her checking the ?financial disputes? box on the form at the time.
example.arg: the ?financial disputes? box on the form

roleset.note: CHECK-V NOTES: Frames file for 'check' based on sentences in financial subcorpus andautomatic expansion via verbnet. (from check.03-v predicate notes)
CHECKING-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry check.03. No VN, no FN mapping. (from checking.03-n)

roleset.name: control, moderate, curb

role.descr: thing that would be uncontrolled otherwise

example.name: attenuate
example.text: The music surged up , but it* failed *PRO* to check it .

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: Failure to check rising medical costs ultimately could `` lead some of us who today are free - market advocates to re-examine our thinking and positions with respect to government - sponsored national health insurance , '' Arthur Puccini , a General Electric Co. vice president , warned earlier this year .

roleset.note: CHECK-V NOTES: Roleset added by Julia based on Brown corpus. Comparison to moderate. No Vncls (from check.07-v)
CHECKING-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry check.07. No VN, FN mapping (from checking.04-n)

roleset.name: have power over, curb or moderate

example.name: Arg1 as "on" PP
example.text: Without treatment, there will be no check on the disease's progression to terminal illness.
example.arg: on the disease's progression to terminal illness.

example.name: Arg1 as "to" PP
example.text: The river put a check to the bloodhounds' tracking of the prisoner's scent.
example.arg: to the bloodhounds' tracking of the prisoner's scent.

example.name: Arg 1 & TMP
example.text: His book is an appeal to a permanent check on the growth and abuses of centralized authority.
example.arg: on the growth and abuses of centralized authority.

example.name: Beneficiary, ArgM-GOL only
example.text: The constitution defines a system of checks and balances for the central government.

example.name: Chess, Arg0 & 1
example.text: The computer program's three checks on my king before the final checkmate was frustrating.

example.name: Cards, Args 0 & 1
example.text: With everyone's check on the betting, it was time to show cards.

example.name: Hockey, Args 0 & 1
example.text: His check of the offense was brilliant.

roleset.note: CHECK-N NOTES: Roleset based on verb entry check.07, OntoNotes grouping check-n senses 4, 6, 8, 9& 12; no relevant mapping to VN. Framed by Claire. (from check.02-n)
This roleset applies to a variety of domains: politics, cards, hockey, chess... (from check.02-n)

roleset.name: check into, as a hotel or conference

role.descr: staff member or other entity enabling the checking in
entity being checked in; future resident

example.name: classic roach motel ad, first half
example.text: ``They check in, but they can't check out.''

example.name: ARG0 and ARG1
example.text: Every time he checks in for yet another surgery , he is announcing to the world that he does n't know who he is , where he is going , and that he thoroughly loathes himself - at least the adult version .

example.name: Args 1 and 2
example.text: The burglar's undoing was his checking into a hotel in Pune.

roleset.note: CHECK-V NOTES: Similarly "check out (of X)" (from check.02-v)
CHECKING-N NOTES: Roleset based on comparison to verb entry check.02. No VN or FN mapping. (from checking.02-n)

example.name: not like a hotel!
example.text: Hundreds of Californians made their way to their computers after the quake, and checked in with each other on electronic bulletin boards, which link computers CB-radio-style, via phone lines.
example.arg: on electronic bulletin boards, which link computers CB-radio-style, via phone lines.

roleset.name: exit, as a hotel; to leave and pay

role.descr: staff member or other entity enabling the checkout; person being paid
entity being checked out; person leaving

example.name: classic roach motel ad, second half
example.text: ``They check in, but they can't check out.''

roleset.name: examine

example.name: transitive
example.text: Let's check out the main contents of today's program.
example.arg: the main contents of today's program.

roleset.note: CHECK_OUT-V NOTES: Frame created by Jena (from check.05-v)

roleset.name: examine

example.text: Our supervisors checked up on us.

roleset.note: CHECK_UP-V NOTES: Frame created by Jena (from check.06-v)
